replies.msg:
Mohamed Salah may leave Liverpool for Barcelona in the summer.

The Egyptian star prefers to play with Leo Messi, but Barca will not take a step in his direction unless Griezmann's plan fails. [Express]
Lucas Digne was selected by Juventus to be a substitute for Alex Sandro if he leaves the Italian club this summer. [calciomercato]

btw source

The meeting between the heavyweights in Barça took place recently in the dressing room and they discussed their defeat.

They talk about their fatigue and how they do not have many players who change the game on the bench. They also expressed their dislike of the match at the end.

A source close to the club heard the players tell Sport: "Now, when they see the bench, they do not accuse the coach, but they feel sad for Valverde because of the lack of options that have been given to him.

The heavyweights in Barça are demanding world-class players this summer.

In addition, many heavyweight players are aware that most of their world class players that Barça has signed recently have advanced (Ibra, Neymar, Dembélé, and Coutinho for example).
.
They are unhappy that the same attention is not given to the defense and the midfield. [Sport]

"The day Iniesta leaves, is the day we will all cry. We will miss him."

Ernesto Valverde considering his Barcelona future - report

There’s been huge focus on Ernesto Valverde in the last few weeks with the Barcelona coach having come under huge criticism after the club’s exit from the Champions League.

The Barca boss saw his team lift their first silverware of the season on Saturday as they crushed Sevilla 5-0 to win the Copa del Rey.

The team now look set to do the double and could be crowned La Liga champions as early as next weekend.

Yet despite being on the brink of doing the double Valverde is reportedly considering leaving the club after just one season, according to AS.

The coach has become unhappy because the board leaked a report to Mundo Deportivo, prior to the Copa del Rey final, that he could be fired if Barca did not beat Sevilla.

The club’s directors reportedly remain furious at the quarter-final Champions League exit. They feel Valverde should have rotated his team far more given they have a healthy lead in La Liga.
